intro: Psoralea biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered psoralea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in grassy areas and along rocky outcrops. The plant features small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in pairs, giving it its common name. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and the plant is often found in well-drained soils. Psoralea biflora is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of local flora.
